answers: Oclaro has been implementing a significant restructuring plan, which includes closing our second major asset sale and initiating a company-wide reorganization to strengthen our market focus. We've also refined our manufacturing strategy and started the process of resizing the company by implementing global headcount reductions. The company is downsizing from approximately 3,000 employees to about 1,500 by July 1, 2014, and the executive team and Board of Directors will reduce our pay by 15%. Oclaro has also taken steps to simplify its global footprint by reducing the number of global sites from about 20 to 10 by the end of June 2014. This restructuring is expected to result in a $10 million to $12 million reduction in quarterly spending.

pred: Oclaro plans to compete in high growth markets following its restructuring by leveraging its technology leadership in indium phosphide and lithium niobate materials, devices and photonic integration to offer highly differentiated products at both the component and module level for high-speed transmission in both client and line side applications.

Our strategy includes the utilization of technology leadership in indium phosphide and lithium niobate materials, devices and photonic integration to offer differentiated products at both the component and module level for high-speed transmission in client and line side applications. The company has been reorganized into two business divisions, one for the client side (optical connectivity) and one for the line side (integrated photonics), with each division responsible for its own operations and contributing about half of the company's revenues.
